result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:34 PM Defendant Michael P Polzin in court in custody from DC Jail.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Michael P Polzin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. V. Girard - Clerk 
20CM236, 22CF299, 22CF26, 21CF99, 21CF94, 22CF134, 22CF174, 20CF422, 20CF411, 20CF407, 22CF185. 20CF266

2:44 pm Atty Larimore to cross
Atty Larimore - client is having medical issue - asks for an adjournment
Court - will address 22CF299 Initial 
Atty Larimore - waive reading
State - request 1 million dollar bond - 2nd charge of threat to Judge - deft has violated bond, serious public safety risk 
Atty Larimore - has strong ties to community - does not rise to level for that amount of cash, can post $1,000 cash
Court - State filed motion to forfeit existing bail
State presents arguments
Atty Larimore - not prepared to proceed at this time
Court - sets bail at $100,000 cash bail Absolute sobriety, no use of any alcoholic beverages or use of controlled substances, prohibited from communicating in any manner, ie in person, by telephone, email, latter, social media posts, and other forms of electronic communications with any person, agencies or entities involved or named in these proceedings, including but not limited to Judges, judicial assistants, Clerk of Courts in St. Croix & in Dunn County, prosecutors, Office of Lawyer Regulation, Office of the WI Judicial Commission, except through your attorney, Atty Larimore, Not to possess any firearms.  A violation will be considered for bail-jumping charges.  Will hold on GPS for now until find out if available.
Be assessed by medical personnel.
Current JT for 22CF26 will remain on the calendar in December with a new date for a Final pre-trial.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Attorney Joel Larimore
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:42 a.m. Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Michael P Polzin. Defendant Michael P Polzin in court. KMS Clerk. Includes 20CF407, 20CF411, 20CF422, 20CM236, 21CF94, 21CF99, 22CF26, 22CF134, 22CF174, 22CF185, 20FO424, 20TR2390, 20TR2392, 21FO205, 21TR1112, 21TR1113, 21TR1114, 21TR1115

Court has received bond modification filing, Defendant has bonded out of jail. Bond modification is moot at this point, Attorney Larimore agrees with the Court
Court  would like to set 22CF26 for a jury trial

ADA Kelly does agree that it makes sense to set a jury trial on 22CF26 and requests that three of the cases that have not had a preliminary hearing held yet be scheduled for a preliminary hearing

Attorney Larimore would like to set the three files for a preliminary hearing and then set 22CF26 for a jury trial

ADA Kelly requests that the Court set 22CF26 for a 2-day jury trial (12/8-12/9 in Dunn County) Final Pre-Trial Conference will be scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. in Dunn County. The Court will draft scheduling order including motion/settlement deadlines.

22CF134, 22CF174, 22CF185 will be set for a preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 from 3:00-4:30 p.m. All other pending files will be set for a status conference on 8/26/2022. 

Hearing concluded at 11:57 a.m.
